channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for DE
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for DE

item.title: Report X-2024050736
item.description:
Report X-2024050736

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-21T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-10
  • City: SEAFORD
  • State: DE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: package was found in van leaking white substance. Package was placed in a hazmat tote. upon inspection bottom of the plastic drum had a crack causing an internal leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024050687
item.description:
Report X-2024050687

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-01
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: DE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO BAY 9 OF UNLOAD TO RETRIEVE A LEAKING PACKAGE. UPON SEEING THE PACKAGE WAS FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZARDOUS, RESPONDER PLACED PACKAGE OUTSIDE IN A SPILL TRAY AND CONSULTED WITH SUPERVISOR AND BUILDING MANAGER FOR NEXT STEPS. RESPONDER PROCESSED PACKAGE IN WELL VENTILATED AREA.
